StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Structural alterations driving castration-resistant prostate cancer revealed by linked-read genome sequencing

Person.Organization: HARVARD MEDICAL SCHOOLBROAD INSTITUTE, INC.DANA-FARBER CANCER INST

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: Origin of this dataset is described in Robinson et al., Cell (2015) and Armenia et al., Nature Genetics (2018). S.R.V. is supported by a Department of Defense Prostate Cancer Research Program Physician Research Award (W81XWH-17-1-0358) and a Young Investigator Award from the Prostate Cancer Foundation. G.H. is supported by the Canadian Institutes for Health Research Postdoctoral Fellowship (MFE-140389). A.M.H. was supported by a postdoctoral fellowship grant (PR-2007-0166) and a overseas research grant from the Norwegian Cancer Society. E.M.V was funded by NIH K08 CA188615 and PCF-V Foundation Challenge Award. S.M.D. was funded by R01CA174777. PCF-V Foundation Challenge Award and Movember-PCF Challenge Award. Circulating free DNA work was supported by the ​Gerstner Family Foundation (to V.A.A)​. P.S.N was supported by P50CA097186; P01CA163227. R.B. is supported by NIH R01 CA215489, The Fund for Innovation in Cancer Informatics. M.M. is supported by an American Cancer Society Research Professorship. Stand Up To Cancer is a program of the Entertainment Industry Foundation administered by the American Association for Cancer Research (SU2C-AACR-DT0712).

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Cancer, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Cancer. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Prostate Cancer, MDS)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-PC-MDS
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Prostate Cancer. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).
